intro: Sarcocapnos baetica, commonly known as the Iberian thorn or Spanish thorn, is a shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain several seeds. Sarcocapnos baetica is often found in scrublands and is an important component of the local flora in southern Spain.
